pr_title: CB-5094: Add connection check for FreeIPA MS to FreeIPA server

timeline.bodyText: this comment is not necessary
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: this method has got a little bit big, could you break it down into smaller methods? typically the empty lines inside the method a good indicator where you should break it
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: I have added some suggestions as you still have some gaps between lines
replies.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: please remove this empty line
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText:
is this from master to replica always valid? If the first freeipa instance goes down and we connect to another, is it still the same message?
After a quick google I could find messages with reversed order. I don't know if it's valid for us, but maybe it's worth checking it.
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: It maybe valid when we have FreeIPA HA.  I created https://jira.cloudera.com/browse/CB-5399 to deal with that once we have a multinode FreeIPA setup.
replies.author: holleyism

timeline.bodyText:
FreeIPA doesn't know anything about resource crns, these parameters should be revisited
cn required IPA server hostname
remote_cn required Remote IPA server hostname
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: if you fetch stack for any reason you should use getFreeIpaClientForStack to reduce db calls

timeline.message:
CB-5094: Add connection check for FreeIPA MS to FreeIPA server

This patch adds the ability to get a detailed status
from FreeIPA servers.  This information will be used
by the CLI and UI to provide detailed status information
for the FreeIPA node. This will also fix CB-5333

timeline.bodyText: please add a unit test for this case
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: I think it would make sense if we make this optional, as there are multiple null check for this
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: as we already check if we have an rcpResponse above, move this part of the code there, and move the parseMessages into the else part. this way we won't check the same at 2 places. Or am I missing something?
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: this case need unit test also, I couldn't find any assert for UNHEALTHY status
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: / should be removed as the others don't have it. thanks

timeline.message:
CB-5094: Add connection check for FreeIPA MS to FreeIPA server

This patch adds the ability to get a detailed status
from FreeIPA servers.  This information will be used
by the CLI and UI to provide detailed status information
for the FreeIPA node. This will also fix CB-5333

timeline.bodyText:
I think this doesn't do what you would expect. this would return true if 1 node is available.
I would use stream here:
return response.getNodeHealthDetailsFreeIpaResponses().stream().allMatch(node -> Status.AVAILABLE == node.getStatus())
or we expect it to be healthy if one node is ok?
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: For HA purposes, it's still healthy if one node is ok.
replies.author: holleyism

replies.bodyText: ok, cool. then anyMatch would do the same, but it's fine with for loop
replies.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: For HA, if there's one node able to return requests then we consider it healthy.  When we sync up the status after the HA work, we might need a new status DEGRADED, to indicate that it can still serve requests, but not everything is ok.
replies.author: holleyism

timeline.bodyText: could you please shortener the name? It is very difficult to handle on the client side (e.g.: any cli)
timeline.author: topolyai5

timeline.bodyText: The generic type is unnecessary
timeline.author: topolyai5

timeline.bodyText: The generic type is unnecessary
timeline.author: topolyai5

timeline.bodyText: please use the placeholder: {}
timeline.author: topolyai5

timeline.bodyText:
this call's during can be more than 2sec (with freeipaClientFactory more than 5 sec). All client will timeout
the autosyncer do the same. I think you can parse the response there and set into the database as a statusReason.

This solution can provide a different status than we now in the db and produce inconsistence operation
timeline.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText:
Per our conversation, 1. the only clients that should be using this today are the ones interacting for HA purposes so we should be able to handle the longer call times.
2. While these are close today, the status we'll need for the individual groups, and nodes in the stack is a slightly different use case.  Additionally, we might need to move away from server_conncheck, but using it for now since it's there.
There will probably be additional permutations of this structure as we get all the HA pieces lined up and once finalized, we will sync up with the describe status.  For now I think it's good to keep these separate because the users are separate, and we might need to add additional details as we work through adding HA.  I create https://jira.cloudera.com/browse/CB-5450 to track the follow up.
replies.author: holleyism
